hanzi-su-wiki:
賂

Значения

Взятка

Мнемоника

Деньги 貝 для каждого 各 чиновника, никого не обижать.

purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
    • 各 [ gè ] individual; each, every; all
heisig_constituent: graft, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, each, walking legs, mouth
heisig_story: To those who believe in the inevitability of graft in government, everything has a price - or as this character has it, to each office its outlay of shells.
koohiiStory1: It might sound simple to bribe someone, but then you have to graft the guy above him and the guy below him, and soon you´re just giving shells to each and everyone!
koohiiStory2: When I was caught by the police doing some graft (graffiti), I gave each cop some clams and told them to be on their way. 賄賂【わいろ】 bribe.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Someone is offering you a shellfish in exchange for a kiss. This is a bribe! You don't want to kiss them, but that shellfish sure looks tasty.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: "Come on, don't you want this shellfish?" they ask, shaking it up and down at you.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You go through with the bribe and kiss the person, but then they snatch hold of the shellfish and run straight down the road (ろ). No!!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: This is why you never accept a bribe. One second you're staring a yummy shellfish in the face, and the next you're standing alone in the road feeling used.
Ru_Notes: Используется почти исключительно в двух словах в примерах.

Ru_Radicals: ハ, 口 (рот), 夂 (зима), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: every (各) shellfish (貝) can be bribed
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Bei " to " Each " sound. The original meaning is to give away money. "Said Wen": "Bribery, legacy. Congbei, each sound." Such as "Poetry. Lu Song. "Pan Shui": "Yuan tortoise elephant teeth, big bribe to Nanjin." Kong Yingdashu: "The briber, in the name of the wealthy survivor, so the bribe is a legacy." "Qin Ce II": "The righteous prince, the wise prince of the barbarians, it is better to bribe the king to soothe his heart."

The extension of " bribe " refers to donated goods. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The twenty-eighth year of Zhuanggong": "Qihou fought against the guard, defeated the guard, counted the king's life, took the bribe and returned it." It also refers to property. Such as "Historical Records. "Xiang Yu Benji": "Soldiers and soldiers half-duty, the Han strikes it, defeats the Chu army, and obtains everything from Chu."

" Bribe " means bribery, that is to buy the property of others. "Zhengzitong. Beibu": "Bribery has its own affiliation but it is left privately." Such as "Book of Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Zhang Fateng and Feng Duyang": "(Feng) is very straightforward, does not offer bribes, and is afraid to do what he wants." Su Xun of the Northern Song Dynasty, "Six Kingdoms": "Six Kingdoms are destroyed, no soldiers are disadvantaged, wars are not good, and the evil lies in bribing the Qin Dynasty. . "" bribes "and" bribery bribery righteousness "are later extended, and by the early literature" bribe "means bribery.
humanum_short_description_en: From " Bei " to " Each " sound. The original meaning is to give away money.
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，「各」聲。本義是贈送財物。《說文》：「賂，遺也。从貝，各聲。」如《詩．魯頌．泮水》：「元龜象齒，大賂南金。」孔穎達疏：「賂者，以財遺人之名，故賂為遺也。」《戰國策．秦策二》：「義渠君者，蠻夷之賢君，王不如賂之以撫其心。」

　　「賂」引申表示贈送的財物。如《左傳．莊公二十八年》：「齊侯伐衛，戰，敗衛師，數之以王命，取賂而還。」又泛指財物。如《史記．項羽本紀》：「士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。」

　　「賂」表示賄賂，即以財物收買他人。《正字通．貝部》：「賂，有所屬而私遺之。」如《後漢書．張法滕馮度楊列傳》：「（馮）緄性烈直，不行賄賂，懼為所中。」北宋蘇洵〈六國語〉：「六國破滅，非兵不利，戰不善，弊在賂秦。」「賄」和「賂」的賄賂義都是後來引申的，早期文獻中用「賕」表示賄賂。
humanum_short_description: 從「貝」，「各」聲。本義是贈送財物。

從「 貝 」，「 各 」聲。本義是贈送財物。《說文》：「賂，遺也。从貝，各聲。」如《詩．魯頌．泮水》：「元龜象齒，大賂南金。」孔穎達疏：「賂者，以財遺人之名，故賂為遺也。」《戰國策．秦策二》：「義渠君者，蠻夷之賢君，王不如賂之以撫其心。」 「 賂 」引申表示贈送的財物。如《左傳．莊公二十八年》：「齊侯伐衛，戰，敗衛師，數之以王命，取賂而還。」又泛指財物。如《史記．項羽本紀》：「士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。」 「 賂 」表示賄賂，即以財物收買他人。《正字通．貝部》：「賂，有所屬而私遺之。」如《後漢書．張法滕馮度楊列傳》：「（馮）緄性烈直，不行賄賂，懼為所中。」北宋蘇洵〈六國語〉：「六國破滅，非兵不利，戰不善，弊在賂秦。」「 賄 」和「 賂 」的賄賂義都是後來引申的，早期文獻中用「 賕 」表示賄賂。
From " Bei" to " Each" sound. The original meaning is to give away money. "Said Wen": "Bribery, legacy. Congbei, each sound." Such as "Poetry. Lu Song. "Pan Shui": "Yuan tortoise elephant teeth, big bribe to Nanjin." Kong Yingdashu: "The briber, in the name of the wealthy survivor, so the bribe is a legacy." "Qin Ce II": "The righteous prince, the wise prince of the barbarians, it is better to bribe the king to soothe his heart." The extension of " bribe" refers to donated goods. Such as "Zuo Zhuan. "The twenty-eighth year of Zhuanggong": "Qihou fought against the guard, defeated the guard, counted the king's life, took the bribe and returned it." It also refers to property. Such as "Historical Records. "Xiang Yu Benji": "Soldiers and soldiers half-duty, the Han strikes it, defeats the Chu army, and obtains everything from Chu." " Bribe" means bribery, that is to buy the property of others. "Zhengzitong. Beibu": "Bribery has its own affiliation but it is left privately." Such as "Book of Later Han Dynasty. "The Biography of Zhang Fateng and Feng Duyang": "(Feng) is very straightforward, does not offer bribes, and is afraid to do what he wants." Su Xun of the Northern Song Dynasty, "Six Kingdoms": "Six Kingdoms are destroyed, no soldiers are disadvantaged, wars are not good, and the evil lies in bribing the Qin Dynasty. . "" bribes"and" bribery bribery righteousness "are later extended, and by the early literature" bribe"means bribery.

賂字的基本解释

賂
lù
见“赂”。

賂字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lù］
［《廣韻》洛故切，去暮，來。］
“赂1”的繁体字。
(1)赠送财物。
(2)赠送的财物。
(3)泛指财物。
(4)以财物买通人，行贿。

賂字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　賂； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1207第18
【唐韻】洛故切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】魯故切，?音路。【說文】遺也。【韻會】以財與人也。【詩·魯頌】大賂南金。【左傳·桓二年】寘其賂器於大廟。

lù
bribe; give present
Radicals: 貝, 各  (shellfish, kiss)
Meaning Mnemonic
Someone is offering you a shellfish in exchange for a kiss. This is a bribe! You don't want to kiss them, but that shellfish sure looks tasty.
"Come on, don't you want this shellfish?" they ask, shaking it up and down at you.
Reading Mnemonic
You go through with the bribe and kiss the person, but then they snatch hold of the shellfish and run straight down the road (ろ). No!!
This is why you never accept a bribe. One second you're staring a yummy shellfish in the face, and the next you're standing alone in the road feeling used.
